Subjective: Left eye irritation x4 days. Onset: Tuesday morning. Redness, swelling, and feeling of hair/speck in eye. Meds: None. Negatives: No trauma, no vision changes, no light sensitivity, no systemic symptoms (flu). Social: Single mother, boyfriend away on holiday. ICE: Concern about contagion and impact on childcare.
Objective: Left eye: redness, swelling, and conjunctival injection. Right eye: mild redness. Pupils reactive to light. No discharge or foreign body seen.
Plan: 1. Reassurance. 2. Artificial tears for symptomatic relief. 3. Return in 2 weeks if symptoms persist or worsen. 4. Safety net: contact if severe pain, increased discharge, or vision changes occur.
